title: CONTENT STRATEGIST - BEIRUT
content:
Our Vision:
Our vision is to inspire brands and people to impact the world. To create big ideas that make a significant contribution to the planet, society, and the bottom line. We believe in today’s world this is the best way for our clients to achieve sustainable growth.   
We achieve this by breaking down the barriers that restrict talent and ideas, we call this Borderless Creativity.        
Which is why our teams work fluidly across 5 capabilities Advertising, Experience, PR, Consulting and Health .   This allows us to not only operate but innovate at the intersection of capabilities and talent.  We believe impact and magic lies at this intersection.   Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries.   
Our mission: We inspire brands and people to impact the world
How we do it : We innovate and operate at the intersection of people and capabilities
What we do: Borderless creativity
Today, Ogilvy is recognized as the world’s leading creative agency. We are also one of the most effective networks globally.
 
 About Memac Ogilvy:
Memac Ogilvy is one of the leading creative networks in MENA with its flagship office in the UAE and a strong local footprint in the GCC and North Africa. It is part of the formidable worldwide WPP & Ogilvy network. It’s the only truly integrated commas network – with Consulting, Advertising- Brand & Content, PR, Experience & Health under 1 P&L and under single leadership. Memac Ogilvy is the most integrated modern creative and effective partner for client growth in MENA. We inspire brands and people to impact the world. We deliver on this by combining expert and new capabilities for modern marketing solutions, with solid project management expertise for agile and effective delivery as well as a thorough and passionate People agenda.
The agency is the most awarded Middle Eastern agency in Cannes as well as a big winner at the local award show Lynx. It counts around 500 staff members
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR :
The Nestle Content Strategist will be central to the Content Studio's output. This individual will be in charge of guaranteeing the cultural adequacy of all content across all included markets. As such, the Content Strategist will have to stay on top of the national, regional, and international trends that could inform, educate, and inspire our work and ensure the right learnings are applied to the content produced by the studio. Operationally, the Content Strategist will have to interface the client's requirements smoothly, the reality of each market, and the creative team in charge of producing content for Nestle. For this, we are looking for a creative thinker who can quickly react to ongoing trends, anticipate them if possible, and easily find potential ways-in for our client to benefit from them.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Trend Watching and Content Research • Stay current on the latest communication and market trends locally, regionally, and internationally. • Quickly convert ongoing trends into learnings and inspiring briefings for the content team to execute • Suggest and validate pertinent trends for the client to leverage in their communications. • Identify locally relevant cultural, social, and economic assets and convert them into communication assets for the client's promotions. • Gain a deep - and ever-changing - understanding of the several target audiences within each market. • Understand which researched and identified elements respond to and support the client's business goals. • Understand and share the status quo of each market (competitors, benchmarks, side markets) as needed. • Research, collect, share, and leverage the latest digital trends in the communication landscape. Content Strategy • Define and constantly refine each market's personas and target audiences • Define and constantly refine how each market's business goals can be converted into communication goals • Define and constantly refine the main elements of the client's content strategy ◦ Messaging ◦ Timings and Calendar ◦ Channeling ◦ Formats • Identify potential new formats, milestones, or activation media to leverage KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES • All content strategy output for this particular client • The quality of the relationship with this particular client • The task pipeline coming from this particular client • The strategic guidance of the content studio creative team • Cultural suitability and impact of the work across all markets and all brands
WHAT YOU WILL BRING:
 ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS • Bachelor’s degree or above (marketing, advertising, communication, design) EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS • 3+ years Experience in digital strategy. • Experience working within a large network communications agency. • Experience with FMCG clients across the region is preferable. • Experience in developing content strategies, writing creative briefs, guiding development and presentation of creative work. LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY • English proficiency - must • Arabic fluency - must PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION • Digital or Social Media certificates is a plus GENERAL SKILLS • Know how to use analytics & tools to track content performance • Strong presentation, communication, and leadership skills. • Ability to work directly with clients and develop relationships on behalf of the agency. • Familiarity with various quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and working knowledge of when and how to apply them to client opportunities/ challenges. • Demonstrate an innate curiosity and insight into human behavior and an instinct for popular culture.
At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
